meanings.definition: A substance that governs the pattern of tissue development in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The morphogens in the embryo help decide how the tissues will grow.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study morphogens to understand how tissues develop in living things.
meanings.sent3: The morphogens at the tissue party were the ones calling the shots on growth patterns.
meanings.sent4: Like conductors in an orchestra, morphogens direct the symphony of tissue development.
meanings.sent5: Imagine morphogens as tiny architects shaping the blueprint of tissue structures.

meanings.definition: Any substance that controls the growth and differentiation of cells during embryonic development.
meanings.sent1: During embryonic development, morphogens guide cell growth and specialization.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are interested in how morphogens influence cell behavior in embryos.
meanings.sent3: The morphogens in the petri dish were like little cell whisperers.
meanings.sent4: Morphogens act as traffic controllers, ensuring cells go to the right destinations.
meanings.sent5: In the dance of embryonic growth, morphogens choreograph the movements of cells.
